intro: Helixanthera tenuis, commonly known as the slender helixanthera, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
